results.title: Stuck on a hot roof
results.creator_credit: Tay Li Nar and School of Creative Media RMIT
results.brief_description: CD-ROM completed as part of Major Project in second year of RMIT Bachelor of Arts in Multimedia. Inspired by the conventional comic strip’s linear format the work attempts to both work within and reinforce the conventions of a left to right frame sequenvce as well as explore the possibilities of breaking these parameters. This prototype interactive comic strip allows for multiple narratives and breaks the sequence to create variable storylines. Suitable for most age groups; contains low level offensive language.

results.title: Stuart Little (Collector's edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Jason Clark, Jeff Franklin II, Steve Waterman and Rob Minkoff
results.brief_description: When his parents want to adopt another child, George Little begs them to bring him home a little brother, however he is surprised when they bring home a mouse who they name Stuart. George resents the intrusion into his family by a mouse, until a model boat race in Central Park draws the two brothers together. Unfortunately, the family cat Snowbell finds the temptation to eat the new family member unbearable and will not rest until Stuart is out of his life. Based on the story by E.B. White. Features the voices of Michael J. Fox, Nathan Lane, Jennifer Tilly and Bruno Kirby.

results.brief_description: A casual meeting of misfits and vagrants on a Saturday afternoon in Albert Park. Featuring Mark Gillespie and ‘Mad’ Danny Kramer.

results.title: Struggle for Pedder
results.brief_description: Beginning with an aggressive argument in favour of flooding Lake Pedder this film, supporting the conservation of the lake, shows through the eyes of a photographer, botanist, artist, zoologist, poet and others, something of the beauty and interest residing in the lake and its surroundings.

results.title: Struggle for oil
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Sydney Newman and Ronald Dick
results.brief_description: The story of the development of the oil resources of the Canadian prairies and how their discovery is affecting the economy of the West. A gusher gone wild, oil crews working feverishly around the clock, oil barons conferring in plush board rooms, the Alberta pipeline, Edmonton’s neon nightlife - these are the glimpses the film shows of how oil is taking its place with agriculture, bringing a new industrial prosperity. Despite the inexhaustible appearance of Alberta’s oil wells, scientists are looking farther north, to the far sands of Athabaska where still greater deposits wait to be released.

results.title: Struggle for China: the story of the Chinese revolution (D)
results.brief_description: Using a wide variety of material drawn from Archives including propaganda material filmed by American, Chinese Communist, Nationalist and Japanese cameramen, this film reconstructs events in China from 1900-1949, one of the bloodiest and most turbulent periods in history. Narrated by James Mason. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB

results.title: Structural fatigue and air safety
results.brief_description: Depicts the three main methods developed and used by the Commonwealth Aeronautical Research Laboratories for testing the strength and resistance of fatigue of aircraft wings.

results.title: Struck by lightning
results.creator_credit: Dark Horse Pictures, Terry J. Charatsis, Trevor Farrant and Jerzy Domaradzki
results.brief_description: Rennie, a middle-aged ex-teacher, now carer of people with Downs Syndrome, has come to believe that humane containment is all that can be hoped for. Pat Cannizzaro, a young idealistic social misfit, believes that intellectually disabled people have the right to full self-realisation through self-expression and social relationships. The film has been praised for its humanity and intelligence. It has also been condemned for its cynical recycling of stereotypes and failure to portray the real issues surrounding the treatment of the intellectually impaired. Cast includes Garry McDonald, Brian Vriends and Catherine McClements.

results.title: Stroszek
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen
results.brief_description: Bruno Stroszek is a contemporary equivalent of Kaspar Hauser. The story was actually inspired by the life of Bruno S. who plays Stroszek. Bruno and his two friends form an oddly assorted trio who escape from Berlin’s low-life to Wisconsin in search of an ‘American dream’ which quickly turns sour. What begins as a low-life melodrama with a realistic edge becomes an absurdist road movie then a metaphysical quest. Bruno’s isolation is lent an underlying perverse logic by Herzog’s favourite circle motif recalling Bruno’s early remark that ‘it (life) all goes round in circles’. Cast includes Bruno S., Eva Mattes, Clemens Scheitz. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Strongest man in the world
results.brief_description: Combines archival film, stills and live footage to present a compelling portrait of Mike Swistun, a seventy-eight year old Canadian farmer of Ukrainian origin, who at one time was billed the ‘strongest man in the world’ by Ringling Brothers’ Barnum and Bailey Circus. Touches on aspects of social change; people’s attitudes to popular entertainment; the changing role of circuses; and the position of old men in modern society. Narrated ny Jack Palance.
